snippet: Jordan Spieth, 20, roared to an early lead in the final round of the Masters and came so close to a groundbreaking victory, but mistakes cost him late and he finished three shots back.
abstract: Bill Pennington On Golf column examines narrow loss by Jordan Spieth at the Masters Golf Tournament, noting that he stood to become youngest person ever to win the competition; holds that Spieth has inspired something of a youth movement, attracting droves of enthusiastic young fans to the tournament.
lead_paragraph: Jordan Spieth, 20, roared to an early lead in the final round of the Masters and came so close to a groundbreaking victory, but mistakes cost him late and he finished three shots back.

headline.main: Spieth Falters and Youth Movement Stalls on Back Nine
headline.print_headline: For Evolved Watson, Jacket Still Fits
